title: "You got me f***ed up": Girl comes at neighbor with a bat, regrets doing so when neighbor takes it from her
description:
The fabric of society is unraveling as we all sit back and revel in the content. Many times, when we present a brawl, it comes from a progressive city where decades of progressive voters electing progressive leaders have led to chaos and anarchy. Don't think we don't realize it can pop off out on these suburban streets too.

The latest in the nasty neighbor video series dropped. Ladies and gentlemen, boys and girls, children of all ages, the Louder with Crowder Dot Com website proudly brings to you...UPPER MIDDLE CLASS MELTDOWN!

How the hell you let that happen lmao pic.twitter.com/nAvtbdRErO
— Lance🇱🇨 (@BornAKang) November 2, 2022

On the undercard, you have the guys fighting. You're free to speculate on what set it off. That's what the comment sections of social media apps are for. I'm thinking someone cheated on a golf score or didn't return a power tool. Whatever the inciteful incident was, the time for talk was over.

Then the women stepped up in the main event. Betty Badass thought she could intimidate the other ladies with her cig and an aluminum bat. Betty also learned an unfortunate lesson.

If you are going to introduce weapons into a street fight, you best be prepared to only use that weapon once. If you miss, the other combatant gets their turn.

Oh, and the other thing is if you introduce a weapon into a street fight, don't let your opponent get their hands on the weapon.

Same energy:

Dynamite Hack-"Boyz In The Hood"_ SEMI-OFFICIAL VIDEO youtu.be

It's the world we live in now. It could be a bar. It could be a children's restaurant. It could be a Walmart. And, it could be a private community where your champagne wishes and caviar dreams descend into chaos.

On behalf of everyone here at the Louder with Crowder Dot Com website: stay safe, be aware of your surroundings, and if sh*t goes down please make sure your smartphone is recording it for us.

>

<

Brodigan is Grand Poobah of this here website and when he isn't writing words about things enjoys day drinking, pro-wrestling, and country music. You can find him on the Twitter too.

title: "This raggedy a** b***": Watch a store owner follow a thief out of the store, onto a bus, and into the arms of the cops
description:
If you work in retail, your boss will tell you not to worry about shoplifters. It's not worth the risk to your wellbeing. However, if you are the boss, you can do whatever you want. Like, for example, following a thief out of your store, onto a bus, and into the waiting arms of the local police. And also, live streaming the entire ordeal because you know us content hustlers need to eat, too.

I think this is where you yell, "YAASSSSSSSS! SLAY GIRL BOSS!"

Normalize following shoplifters home on the bus. pic.twitter.com/XVBj5h0aWW
— Louder with Crowder Dot Com (@LWCnewswire) May 20, 2023

Being a small business owner is a thankless job. It's even more thankless if you are trying to do business in a city where progressive politicians have made shoplifting all but legal. Our thief friend, we'll call her Becki, picked the wrong store to rob on the wrong day because Boss Babe had enough. She had a fully charged iPhone and no f*cks left to give.

It wasn't even enough to get Becki arrested. Boss Babe made sure Becki was ridiculed with all due disrespect and broadcasted it throughout all of the internets how badly she sucks at life.

What I don't understand from the video is why Becki didn't realize she was screwed, give Boss Babe all the stolen goods back, and get off at the next bus stop. You were caught. There was no getting out of this. Take the L and wait for the local cops coming by in the next thirty minutes. Instead, besides being a criminal, Becki was also a nincompoop. She let Boss Babe follow her to her house, where police were waiting.

Now, Becki is all over the internet, bringing shame to her family for generations to come. Decades from now, kids are going to be showing their friends this clip and saying, "Hey, check out my idiot great-great-grand cousin."

Unclear from the video is what city this takes place in. If it's LA or NYC, Becki is already out on bail.

>

<

Brodigan is Grand Poobah of this here website and when he isn't writing words about things enjoys day drinking, pro-wrestling, and country music. You can find him on the Twitter too.

title: Watch: TikToker livestreams stealing old lady's dog in a park, but don't worry... it was a viral "prank"
description:
I half don't want to write this because it only accomplishes giving this guy the attention he is looking for (and reveling in). But it's part of a bigger viral trend of losers so desperate to go viral, they play "pranks" on people. And if they aren't careful, they are going to prank the wrong person and wind up dead.

A clown went viral during the week livestreaming himself walking into strangers' homes. Some call it "content." People without their heads up their arses call it breaking and entertaining. Turns out the TikToker, who says he's been looking to go viral since he was eight, also steals old lady's dogs. You know, as a "prank."

The British live-streamer who walked into a random house to harass the people living there stole a person's dog at the park for clout. pic.twitter.com/ATmz2b8jtd
— Catch Up (@CatchUpFeed) May 19, 2023

Here is another angle. Remember, part of what makes the "prank" "funny" is the reaction of the old woman who thinks her dog has been stolen.

This is another video in a different angle from his YouTube channel🤬🤬 I feel so sorry for the old lady. pic.twitter.com/cHgo1YBBq0
— Queen babe 👑 (@VingyWakey) May 20, 2023

FWIW, this dinkus may have taken his account down or HAD his account taken down. I attempted to do a journalism this morning and see if he was arrested, or if there was a video of him getting the sh*t kicked out of him by other parkgoers. Though if that was the case, the media would have turned this into a story about "Dog Park Karen."

Instead, his video "How to get a free dog" and his TikTok account are currently unavailable.

This is a trend that needs to die a quick death before the livestreamer does. And the person who thought they were having their luggage stolen at the airport or thought someone was trying to murder them by setting them on fire is vilified in the media for defending themselves.

Making someone think you are committing a crime against them is not a prank. It's justification for that person acting in self-defense. Like and subscribe.

>

<
